title: Stocks to watch, December 27: Jubilant FoodWorks, Mamata Machinery, NHPC, Mankind Pharma, Dixon Technologies, Gensol Engineering, and more - Upstox
summary:
Stocks to watch, December 27

Date: December 27, 2023 | Source: Market News

The domestic equity market is poised for a flat opening, influenced by subdued global cues, with several key stocks expected to draw investor attention today.

  • Mamata Machinery: IPO listed today; oversubscribed 194.95 times.
  • RedTape Ltd: Declares ₹2 interim dividend and issues 3:1 bonus shares.
  • Dixon Technologies: MOU with Cellecor for refrigerator manufacturing.
  • Gensol Engineering: Awarded ₹897 crore contract from NTPC for solar projects.
  • IndusInd Bank: Plans to auction ₹1,573 crore in distressed microfinance loans.
  • Mankind Pharma: Partnership with Innovent to commercialize cancer immunotherapy drug in India.
  • NHPC: Reports ₹1,075.97 crore loss from flash flood at Teesta-V power station.
  • Power Mech: Secures ₹186 crore order for maintenance services from JPVL.
  • Jubilant FoodWorks: MoU with Coca-Cola to market beverage products.
  • Gujarat Fluorochemicals: Approves slump sale of 57 MW power plant for ₹200 crore.
  • Electrosteel Castings: Scheduled shutdown for maintenance at Srikalahasthi Unit.
  • Quess Corp: High Court quashes penalty orders from IT Department amounting to ₹180.05 crores.
  • ACME Solar Holdings: Secures ₹1,988 crore loan for hybrid renewable energy project.
  • Lemon Tree Hotels: Announces new hotel signing in Bapane, Maharashtra, expected to open in FY 2026.

Investors should keep an eye on these stocks as they could significantly influence market performance today.
newTitle: Stocks to watch for December 27: Key market movers

title: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO allotment status out. Latest GMP, how to check status online | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:

Senores Pharmaceuticals Limited has concluded its IPO bidding, and applicants can now check their allotment status online. The latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) indicates a promising return forecast for investors.

Highlights:

  • IPO bidding closed on December 24, 2024.
  • IPO allotment status can be checked on the BSE website or through Link Intime India.
  • GMP stands at ₹242, anticipating a listing price of ₹633.

title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is... | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is...

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Live Mint

In a recent post, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revisited the contentious 70-hour work week debate, questioning its necessity for economic development and the impact of such work culture on demographics.

The rationale behind the 70 hour work week is "it is necessary for economic development". If you look at East Asia - Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and China have all developed through extreme hard work, often imposing punitive levels of work on their own people.

Key Points:

  • Vembu cites East Asian nations as examples of economic growth alongside intense work hours.
  • He raises concerns about the low birth rates resulting from stringent work cultures.
  • Two key questions are posed: Is extreme work necessary for development? Is the resultant solitary old age worth the cost?
  • Vembu believes a minority of the workforce driving hard is sufficient for development, advocating for a work-life balance.
  • He warns against replicating the steep demographic decline seen in some East Asian countries.
newTitle: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu Challenges the 70-Hour Work Week Debate

title: Reliance Industries to Trent and Asian Paints — 10 Nifty stocks that made records in 2024 - CNBCTV18
summary:
Reliance Industries to Trent and Asian Paints — 10 Nifty stocks that made records in 2024

Published on: 2024, Source: CNBC TV18

This year has been eventful for the Nifty 50 index, which has seen a 9% gain overall, with some stocks achieving records for positive and negative reasons.

  • Reliance Industries sees a potential first year of negative returns since 2014, dropping by 5.5% this year.
  • Asian Paints faces its worst calendar year on record, analysts now mostly recommend sell with targets ranging from ₹2,080 to ₹3,750.
  • Trent emerges as a top performer with a significant increase in stock value for consecutive years.
  • Mahindra & Mahindra achieves its best returns since 2009, with a stock increase of 70% this year.
  • HDFC Bank continues to provide positive returns, maintaining a strong buy rating from analysts.
  • HUL and Nestle India report their worst years since 2004 and 2002 respectively.
  • IndusInd Bank shows a significant decline, with over 40% drop in stock performance.
  • Adani Ports consistently delivers positive returns, maintaining a buy consensus from analysts.
“Adani Ports has managed a positive calendar year, the fifth time in a row it has done so.”

The performance in 2024 of various Nifty stocks illustrates a mix of turnaround successes and significant downturns, indicating a complex landscape for investors.
newTitle: Reliance Industries to Trent and Asian Paints — 10 Nifty stocks that made records in 2024

title: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Out: GMP At 61.38%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status On - News18
summary:
Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Out: GMP At 61.38%, A Step-By-Step Guide To Check Allotment Status Online

Last Updated: December 27, 2024, 03:21 IST

The IPO allotment for Senores Pharmaceuticals Ltd has been finalized, with shares currently trading in the grey market at Rs 631, which is 61.38% higher than the issue price.

  • The IPO was subscribed 97.86 times, with significant interest from retail and institutional investors.
  • The price band for the IPO was set between Rs 372 and Rs 391 per share.
  • The shares will officially list on the BSE and NSE on December 30.
  • To check the IPO allotment status, investors can visit BSE or Link Intime’s website.
“The GMP is based on market sentiments and keeps changing. Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

The IPO aims to fund a manufacturing facility and support various corporate purposes, ensuring growth and product development in the pharmaceutical sector.
newTitle: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO Allotment Finalized: GMP Rises to 61.38%

title: Bank frauds jump 8 times in first half of FY25 over a year - The Times of India
summary:
Bank frauds jump 8 times in first half of FY25 over a year

Publication Date: unknown Source: unknown

This article reports on a significant increase in bank fraud cases, which have risen eightfold in the first half of Financial Year 2025 compared to the previous year, highlighting serious concerns over security within the banking sector.

  • The number of reported bank frauds has surged in the initial months of FY25.
  • This increase prompts urgent calls for enhanced regulatory measures and fraud prevention strategies.
  • Experts suggest that improved technology could help mitigate risks.
“The rise in fraud cases is alarming and must be addressed immediately to protect customers and banks alike.”

In conclusion, the dramatic rise in bank frauds this fiscal year raises critical questions about security and regulatory oversight in the financial sector.
newTitle: Bank Fraud Incidents Surge Eightfold in Early FY25

title: Rupee remains under pressure, hits record low of 85.28 vs $ - The Times of India
summary:
Rupee Hits Record Low of 85.28 Against Dollar

Date: October 2023 | Source: Economic Times

The Indian Rupee continues to face pressure, hitting a record low of 85.28 against the US dollar, raising concerns in the financial markets.

  • The Rupee has depreciated significantly due to various economic factors.
  • Experts are analyzing the implications of this decline on the economy.
  • Government interventions and monetary policy changes are being discussed as potential responses to stabilize the currency.
“This is the highest level of depreciation we have seen in recent months, and it raises alarms about inflation and trade deficits.”

Market analysts emphasize the potential long-term effects this could have on inflation and economic stability in India.
newTitle: Rupee Hits Record Low of 85.28 Against Dollar

title: RBI policies may have contributed to economic slowdown: Finance ministry - The Times of India
summary:
RBI Policies Linked to Economic Slowdown, Says Finance Ministry

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Finance Ministry has stated that the policies of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) may have contributed to the ongoing economic slowdown in the country. This assertion sheds light on the complex interplay between monetary policy and economic performance.

  • The Finance Ministry attributes the slowdown partially to RBI's monetary policies.
  • Concerns exist about how these policies impact inflation and growth.
  • The discussion includes potential changes in RBI's approach to stimulate the economy.
“Monetary policy needs to be more aligned with growth objectives,” a ministry official commented.

The Finance Ministry's evaluation highlights growing awareness of the need for coordinated policy responses to support economic revitalization.
newTitle: RBI Policies Linked to Economic Slowdown, Says Finance Ministry

The NSE Nifty 50 is currently consolidating with immediate support at 23,500 and resistance at 23,855. Analysts suggest a decisive move above 23,855 could push the index higher towards 24,000-24,100.

  • Immediate support identified near 23,500.
  • Resistance noted at 23,855 level.
  • Decisive move above 23,855 may lead to index gains towards 24,000-24,100.

"On the downside, 23,500 serves as immediate support. In the short term, the index is expected to consolidate within the 23,500–23,850 range." - Hrishikesh Yedve

The Nifty is likely to see range-bound activity in the near future, awaiting significant market triggers from upcoming earnings.

title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 175.31x led by QIBs & NIIs. Check GMP, review | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue booked 175.31x led by QIBs & NIIs. Check GMP, review

Publication Date: 26 Dec, 2024 8:32:55 AM
Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

Unimech Aerospace has concluded its IPO with significant oversubscription, registering a total of 175.31 times as the bidding period closes. The offer includes up to ₹250 crore in fresh issues and an equal amount in offer-for-sale (OFS), priced between ₹745-785 per share.

  • The Qualified Institutional Buyer (QIB) portion saw an oversubscription of 317.63 times.

The grey market premium (GMP) indicates a potential listing gain of approximately 80% over the IPO price.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday - The Economic Times
summary:
Market Analysis: Key Factors Influencing Stock Market Action on Friday

Publication Date: December 26, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Indian benchmark indices ended flat on the monthly expiry day as a range-bound trade prevailed, influenced by weakness in FMCG and bank stocks, yet auto and pharma stocks provided some support.

  • The S&P BSE Sensex settled at 78,472.48, down by 0.39 points.
  • The Nifty closed at 23,750.20, gaining 22.55 points or 0.1%.
  • Analysts note that Nifty's sideways movement indicates investors are cautious, struggling to rise to higher levels.
  • US markets are experiencing a light trading volume and rising yields impacting stocks.
  • European markets were closed on this day.
  • Most active stocks included One Mobikwik Systems, Vishal Mega Mart, and Reliance Industries.
  • Over 155 stocks hit their 52-week highs, while 80 fell to their lows.
"The index remained below the 200 DMA, reinforcing the weakness. The short-term movement remains under pressure." - Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst

In summary, market sentiment remains bearish as heavyweights like HDFC Bank and Reliance Industries have dragged markets to a flat ending, with more declines than advances among traded stocks.
newTitle: Market Analysis: Key Factors Influencing Stock Market Action on Friday

title: Is Microsoft and OpenAI's tech bromance fraying? The ChatGPT maker's GPT-4 model is "too slow and expensive" to meet Copilot 365 users' needs. - Windows Central
summary:
Is Microsoft and OpenAI's Tech Bromance Fraying?

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Windows Central

The relationship between Microsoft and OpenAI, marked by a $13 billion investment, faces challenges as Microsoft considers integrating its own AI models into Microsoft 365 Copilot, potentially moving away from OpenAI's expensive GPT-4 model.

  • Microsoft is reported to be dissatisfied with GPT-4's speed and cost, which do not meet enterprise demands.
  • The company plans to integrate non-OpenAI AI models into its services.
  • There are concerns over OpenAI meeting computing power demands, jeopardizing its goal of achieving AGI.
  • Microsoft's Copilot has been criticized for not performing adequately, with some clients finding it unreliable.
  • OpenAI’s CEO hinted at AGI being achieved sooner than expected, yet there are financial concerns about the partnership.
“The AI-powered tool doesn't work well 75% of the time.”

In conclusion, the partnership between Microsoft and OpenAI may be at a crossroads as both companies navigate their respective ambitions and capabilities in the AI domain.
newTitle: Is Microsoft and OpenAI's Tech Partnership Deteriorating?

title: Microsoft wants to add third-party AI models to Copilot 365 without OpenAI's help - Windows Central
summary:
Is Microsoft and OpenAI's tech bromance fraying?

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Windows Central

Microsoft's multi-billion dollar partnership with OpenAI is reportedly facing challenges as the costs and performance of OpenAI's GPT-4 model are not meeting enterprise customer needs.

  • Microsoft has invested $13 billion in OpenAI and relies on its AI models for many products.
  • There are plans to integrate new non-OpenAI models into Microsoft 365 Copilot services.
  • Issues with the GPT-4 model include high costs and speed, prompting Microsoft to explore alternatives.
  • OpenAI's team cites concerns that Microsoft's computing power demands may hinder the pursuit of AGI.
  • Disagreements over partnerships and costs further complicate their collaboration.
“Microsoft's CTO described most Copilot AI tools as 'gimmicky' and noted a heavy reliance on third-party vendors.”

This partnership's future may hinge on both parties' ability to adapt to evolving technology demands and operational efficiencies.
newTitle: Is Microsoft and OpenAI's Partnership Facing Challenges?

title: Hyderabad real estate juggernaut losing steam as sales drop drastically - Telangana Today
summary:
Hyderabad Real Estate Juggernaut Losing Steam As Sales Drop Drastically

Published Date - 26 December 2024, Source - Telangana Today

Hyderabad's property market, which had seen significant growth over the past decade, is experiencing a decline with sales dropping drastically and new launches being put on hold.

  • Sales in Hyderabad dropped by 5% in 2024, with total units sold falling from 61,715 to 58,540.
  • New supplies decreased by 24%, with only 58,335 new units launched compared to 76,345 the previous year.
  • The overall housing market in the top seven cities saw a 4% decline in sales.
  • Luxury housing demand has remained strong, with a 24% increase in new supply in 2024.
Anuj Puri, Chairman – Anarock Group, stated, “Average residential prices hikes will stabilise in the coming year...”

The current slowdown signals a notable shift in the dynamics of Hyderabad's real estate market, indicating a need for strategic adjustments from developers and investors.
newTitle: Hyderabad Real Estate Market Faces Significant Sales Decline

title: Govt imposes restrictions on import of low ash metallurgical coke for 6 months | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Govt imposes restrictions on import of low ash metallurgical coke for 6 months

Date: December 26, 2023 Source: PTI

The government has announced import restrictions on low ash metallurgical coke for six months, effective from January 1, 2025, to June 30, 2025. This includes quantitative restrictions from various countries.

  • Import restrictions apply to low ash metallurgical coke.
  • Quantitative restrictions are set for imports from countries such as Australia, China, Colombia, and others.
  • High ash content coke (above 18%) is not subject to these restrictions.
  • The imports will require authorisation from the Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT).
  • Quarterly monitoring will ensure that imports do not exceed specified quotas.
"The country-wise QR will be effective from January 2025 and will cease automatically on June 30, next year."

This measure aims to regulate the import of low ash metallurgical coke and ensure compliance with trade remedies.
newTitle: Govt imposes restrictions on import of low ash metallurgical coke for 6 months

title: SC allows banks to charge 30% interest rates on credit card dues - The Times of India
summary:
SC Allows Banks to Charge 30% Interest Rates on Credit Card Dues

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Times of India

The Supreme Court has approved a regulation allowing banks to charge a maximum annual interest rate of 30% on credit card dues, stating that such rates are reasonable under current economic conditions.

  • The decision aligns with the banking sector's need to manage risks associated with credit.
  • The ruling emphasizes the importance of credit card usage in the modern consumer economy.
  • Consumer protection measures and transparency in fee disclosures were also highlighted.
"This decision is crucial for maintaining the balance between consumer protection and the financial stability of banks," the Supreme Court stated.

This ruling is expected to shape the future of credit card policies in India, ensuring that banks can sustain themselves while not overburdening consumers.
newTitle: SC Allows Banks to Charge 30% Interest Rates on Credit Card Dues

title: Market Trading Guide: Himadri Speciality Chemical, Petronet LNG are stock recommendations for Friday - The Economic Times
Reliance Jio Launches Rs 601 Annual Plan For Unlimited 5G Data: Benefits, Validity, How To Avail - Times Now
summary:
Reliance Jio Launches Rs 601 Annual Plan for Unlimited 5G Data

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times Now

Reliance Jio announces a new annual plan priced at Rs 601 offering unlimited 5G data and enhanced 4G benefits, along with options for gifting.

  • The Rs 601 plan provides unlimited 5G data and increases the daily 4G quota to 3GB.
  • Eligible customers must be on a plan that includes at least 1.5GB of 4G data daily.
  • Users will receive 12 upgrade vouchers, valid for 30 days each.
  • The plan can easily be gifted through the MyJio app.
  • For those not ready for an annual plan, smaller upgrade options are available priced at Rs 51, Rs 101, and Rs 151.
“This plan provides a wonderful way to experience uninterrupted 5G connectivity throughout the year.”

This offering from Reliance Jio not only enhances current plans but also makes connectivity accessible at an affordable rate.
newTitle: Reliance Jio Launches Rs 601 Annual Plan for Unlimited 5G Data

Stocks to watch: Larsen & Toubro, RBL Bank, Gland Pharma, RedTape and more

title: Bad loans decline: Banks’ gross NPA ratio declines to over 13-year low of 2.5% as at end September, says RBI report - The Indian Express
summary:
Banks' Gross NPA Ratio Hits 13-Year Low at 2.5%: RBI Report

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) reports that the gross non-performing assets (GNPAs) ratio of scheduled commercial banks has decreased to 2.5%, marking the lowest level in over 13 years as of September 2024.

  • The GNPAs fell from 2.7% at the end of March 2024 to 2.5% in September 2024.
  • The agricultural sector records the highest GNPA ratio at 6.2% while retail loans show the lowest at 1.2%.
  • GNPA for education loans decreased to 2.7% from 5.8% at end-March 2023.
  • Banks' net NPA (NNPA) ratio reached a decade low of 0.57% as of September 2024.
  • The slippage ratio improved for banks for the third consecutive year.
“Asset quality improved, with the GNPA ratio falling to its lowest in 13 years at 2.5%,” stated the RBI report.

This improvement in asset quality is attributed to better recoveries and upgrades in the banking sector.
newTitle: Banks' Gross NPA Ratio Hits 13-Year Low at 2.5%: RBI Report
